alert.note: Alert for Harnett; Johnston; Wake; Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 3:26PM EDT until September 30 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Harnett, Johnston, Wake and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 324 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. A combination of the heavy rain and strong wind will also increase the risk of uprooted trees. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Goldsboro, Smithfield, Mount Olive, Lillington, Wake Forest, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Clayton, Dunn, Zebulon, Angier, Benson, Fremont, Walnut Creek, RDU International, Apex and Holly Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
